body: Every young foot is shaped differently, so the requirements for a school shoe differ from foot to foot.
title: Text Title

body:
You need to be confident and knowledgeable in shoe fitting to sell to your customer. Keep in mind the importance for the long-term health of a childâ€™s foot, to be wearing supportive shoes that fit.


It is important to build rapport with your customer and their child to make them feel at ease. Treat them with respect and engage with them in a friendly, helpful and professional way.


Try these guidelines to get you started.
title: Text Title

body: Approach and greet the customer and child in a friendly way.
title: Text Title

body: Build rapport by engaging with the parent. Find out what they are looking for and try to establish the child's age and development stage.
title: Text Title

body: Give the customer and the child a positive shopping experience by going out of your way to help them find what they're looking for.
title: Text Title

_items.title: THE HEEL BIT

_items.title: THE TOE BIT

body:
Firstly we'll measure their feet, then do the walk test, to ensure they go home with the perfect fit in their brand new school shoes.


Let's get started.
title: Text Title

_items.body:
The child must be seated when you place their foot in the gauge.


Measure with socks on - ensure the sock is a suitable thickness , otherwise use try-on socks.


Measure both feet.
Make sure the leg is at a right angle and the gauge is on a hard, flat surface.
Check that the heel is in the back of the gauge.
Check that the foot is straight on the gauge.
Hold down the toes and ease the slide of the gauge to the tip of the longest toe and take note of the size.

Measure and note the width of the foot.


You are now ready to measure the second foot.

title: Time now to measure the feet

_items.body: Once youâ€™ve put the shoes on, check the space from the big toe to the tip of the shoe with your thumb. There should be about a 14mm gap.

Check the width of the shoe by using your hand to slide gently, but firmly, along the sides of the shoe to make sure there is no pressure.


For Mary-Janes, slide your finger under the front, top of the shoe to check there is enough width.

Check the depth of the shoe â€“ too many creases means too much depth.


Make sure the lugs are parallel and about 10mm apart.
Check the shoe is gripping the heel well.
Check that the anklebone is clear of the topline of the shoe.

Check that the heel is sitting right back in the heel cup before standing the child up and closing the Velcro or tying the laces.


Make sure the Velcro closes correctly and is not too short or too long.


If the Velcro is too short, try taking out the top innersole (only in E+ styles). This allows the foot to drop down into the shoe and give you more depth and width.

body:
What if the shoe isnâ€™t fitting well and does not pass the 5-point fit check?


1. Check that the shoes are on properly.

2. Re-measure both feet if necessary.

3. Try new size.

4. Repeat the 5-point fit check.


Time for the walk test!
title: Not fitting well?

_items.title: FITS WELL
_items.body: Check that the shoe is not slipping and the child is walking naturally in it.

_items.title: GROWING ROOM
_items.body: Check there is plenty of growing room so the child will get lots of wear out of it.

_items.title: SOFT HEEL
_items.body: Check with the child that it feels comfortable with a soft feel as they will be wearing the shoes for long periods of time.

_items.title: LIGHTWEIGHT AND FLEXIBLE
_items.body: Check the shoe is lightweight and flexible enough for easy movement and comfort.
Check the shoe is stable and supportive around the foot to encourage upright movement.
_items.title: STABLE AND SUPPORTIVE

body:
Donâ€™t forget to check if your customer and child need sports shoes for school!


Also remind them about the â€˜back to schoolâ€™ pop-up, where they can find items including the following:


â€¢ Socks

â€¢ Underwear

â€¢ Lunchboxes

â€¢ Drink bottles

â€¢ Stationery.
title: Text Title

body:
To recap on some key points, once youâ€™ve correctly measured the foot:


â€¢ Do the 5-point fit check

â€¢ Do the walk test

â€¢ Check for any add-on sale opportunities.


And remember to connect and engage with your customer and their child throughput the process.
title: Text Title
